thread.title: LETTERS: High-speed rail a disaster
thread.title_full: LETTERS: High-speed rail a disaster - Press Enterprise

author: The Press-Enterprise
title: LETTERS: High-speed rail a disaster
text:
PRESS-ENTERPRISE
Published: Oct. 23, 2015 Updated: 4:21 p.m. Re: “Private money running from train” [Editorial, Oct. 23]: So who will buy the bonds to finance this boondoggle of a high-speed railroad? China? India? At what rate? Ten percent or even 15 percent tax free? This is all just another compelling reason to abandon the construction of this boondoggle of a high speed-rail from nowhere to nowhere.
The cost estimate of $10 billion which we voted on is now $68 billion, and who knows what it will be before it is finished? And where are the federal funds that were promised? And if finally it is put into operation, will it operate at a profit? You can bet it won’t. Wake up California before it is too late. Stop the high-speed rail before it bankrupts our state.
G. M. Cameron
Hemet
Votes over citizens
Re: “San Francisco reaffirms its status as immigrant sanctuary” [News, Oct. 21]: The Democrats have proven beyond any doubt that votes are more important than the lives of U.S. citizens.
What a sorry bunch of anti-American buffoons.
This country is doomed.
Chuck R. Bolton
San Jacinto
Tragedy averted
“Trust in police pummeled” [Editorial, Oct. 20] mentions Nicholas Johnson being shot from a helicopter, but did not mention that Mr. Johnson was driving at a high speed on the wrong side of the freeway. All drivers should give their grateful thanks to the Sheriff Department’s helicopter for averting possible horrendous head-on collisions.
Maureen Baker
Corona
WRITE A LETTER TO THE EDITOR: Letters to the Editor: E-mail to letters@pe.com . Please provide your name, city and telephone number (telephone numbers will not be published). Letters of about 200 words will be given preference. Letters will be edited for length, grammar and clarity.
